Operation 'getProxy' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_input_details, missing_output_details. Original summary 'GET' is just the HTTP method and provides no semantic value. Description lacks clarity on required inputs (downstream URL header, consumer ID), expected outputs (response format), and how credentials are injected. Added specific header requirements, credential injection mechanism, and return behavior for better AI agent understanding of when and how to use this operation.

data.current_description:
Proxies a downstream GET request to a service and injects the necessary credentials into a request stored in Vault. This allows you to have an additional security layer and logging without needing to rely on Unify for normalization.
**Note**: Vault will proxy all data to the downstream URL and method/verb in the headers.
data.summary_suggestion: Forward GET request with credential injection
data.description_suggestion: Forwards a GET request to a downstream service specified in the x-apideck-downstream-url header, automatically injecting credentials from Vault. Requires x-apideck-consumer-id to identify the customer and retrieve their stored credentials. Returns the downstream service's response with status code and body. Enables secure credential management and request logging without requiring Unify normalization.
data.reasoning: Original summary 'GET' is just the HTTP method and provides no semantic value. Description lacks clarity on required inputs (downstream URL header, consumer ID), expected outputs (response format), and how credentials are injected. Added specific header requirements, credential injection mechanism, and return behavior for better AI agent understanding of when and how to use this operation.

data.current_description:
Proxies a downstream POST request to a service and injects the necessary credentials into a request stored in Vault. This allows you to have an additional security layer and logging without needing to rely on Unify for normalization.
**Note**: Vault will proxy all data to the downstream URL and method/verb in the headers.
data.summary_suggestion: Forward POST request with credential injection
data.description_suggestion: Forwards a POST request with request body to a downstream service specified in the x-apideck-downstream-url header, automatically injecting credentials from Vault. Requires x-apideck-consumer-id to identify the customer and retrieve their stored credentials. Request body is passed through to the downstream service. Returns the downstream service's response including status code and response body. Creates or modifies resources on the downstream service. Enables secure credential management and request logging without requiring Unify normalization.
data.reasoning: Original summary 'POST' lacks semantic value. Description missing details about request body handling, side effects (resource creation/modification), and response format. Added clarification that request body is forwarded, that POST creates/modifies resources, and specified return behavior for AI agents to understand this operation's impact.

Operation 'getProxy' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_input_details, missing_output_details. Original summary 'GET' is just the HTTP method and provides no semantic value. Description lacks clarity on required inputs (downstream URL header, consumer ID), expected outputs (response format), and how credentials are injected. Added specific header requirements, credential injection mechanism, and return behavior for better AI agent understanding of when and how to use this operation.

data.current_description:
Proxies a downstream GET request to a service and injects the necessary credentials into a request stored in Vault. This allows you to have an additional security layer and logging without needing to rely on Unify for normalization.
**Note**: Vault will proxy all data to the downstream URL and method/verb in the headers.
data.summary_suggestion: Forward GET request with credential injection

Enables secure credential management and request logging without requiring Unify normalization.

Description lacks clarity on required inputs (downstream URL header, consumer ID), expected outputs (response format), and how credentials are injected.
